properties.areaDesc: Coastal Waters of Northern Puerto Rico out 10 NM; Mona Passage Southward to 17N; Coastal Waters OF Northwestern Puerto Rico out 10 NM; Atlantic Waters of Puerto Rico AND USVI from 10 NM to 19.5N
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued January 10 at 11:00PM AST until January 10 at 11:45PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in San Juan has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Atlantic Waters of Puerto Rico AND USVI from 10 NM to 19.5N...
Coastal Waters OF Northwestern Puerto Rico out 10 NM...
Coastal Waters of Northern Puerto Rico out 10 NM...
Mona Passage Southward to 17N...

* Until 1145 PM AST.

* At 1059 PM AST, severe thunderstorms capable of producing
waterspouts were located along a line extending north of Arecibo,
moving west at 35 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts 34 knots or greater.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally
hazardous seas. Small craft could be damaged in briefly
higher winds and suddenly higher waves.

* Severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly open waters.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor until hazardous weather passes.

Thunderstorms can produce sudden waterspouts. Waterspouts can easily
overturn boats and create locally hazardous seas. Seek safe harbor
immediately.

Report severe weather to the Coast Guard or the National Weather
Service. You can also share your report with NWS San Juan on
Facebook and Twitter.
